intro: Lasianthus pseudolongifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lasianthus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Thailand and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
